lexUnit.name: radiate.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: emit (light, heat, or other energy) in the form of rays or waves.

sentence.text: The power of a shaman comes from the the raw Waaagh energy radiated by all the Orcs and Goblins near him .
Now since the number of waves a second is unlimited , this would mean that the total energy radiated would be infinite .
The cloud 's rising internal heat can no longer be radiated away into space , and the dust cloud -- originally resembling a giant gaseous ball like Jupiter -- becomes a warm gassy protostar .
They normally feature a convector heat exchanger rather than relying on heat simply to be radiated from glowing ceramic coals/logs .
Darker surfaces absorb heat , which is then radiated as the temperature falls towards the end of the day .
With his burly , four-square stance , his ruddy colouring , his handsome strong-featured face , he radiated energy , warmth and good nature .
The hot stars radiate energy as this hydrogen is converted to helium in their nuclear furnaces .
When nicely balanced , these forces permit the star a lifecycle as it radiates energy to finish as a lump of heavy elements .

The latest Bulletin of the American Mathematical Society resolves a question that came to light in the days of Lord Rayleigh , who showed how an idealised object called a black body radiates heat and light energy .
The Sun radiates energy over the whole electromagnetic spectrum , but the Earth 's atmosphere is transparent only to infra-red , visible , and some ultraviolet light .
In this state the electron could not radiate energy in the form of electromagnetic waves because there would be no lower energy state for it to go to .
Herbert 's piece radiates confidence in its control of language and its message .
Not surprisingly , it radiates magic to a character with Magic Sense skill .
Aglow , the intruder radiated his own natural wavelengths luminously like some alien Eldar attired in a holo-suit .
She lifted her chin , radiating defiance .
The third jet is evidently created when either the quark or the antiquark radiates a gluon , which in its turn creates another shower of particles .
As is usual with electrostatic headphones , the design is openbacked which means that both sides of the diaphragm are free to radiate sound waves .
But the classical theory predicted that the electrons would radiate electromagnetic waves .
The output of this bellows-like set-up is radiated into the room via a smoothly contoured port situated on the fascia below the coincident driver .
She radiated warmth and we chatted easily on the ride back to the flat , then sat shoeless on the floor in front of the gas-fire , swapping husband humour and sipping coffee .
A paradoxical property of black holes is that they can radiate through a quantum field effect discovered by Hawking ( 1974 ) .

However , in the end most people , including John Taylor , have come to the conclusion that black holes must radiate like hot bodies if our other ideas about general relativity and quantum mechanics are correct .
Now , the apparent brightness of a star depends on two factors : how much light it radiates ( its luminosity ) , and how far it is from us .
